Author: menagerath

Comment: > There were a shitload of people who voted against him, an thousands, if not millions more who had their votes thrown out or otherwise suppressed.  I never said I blame democratic voters, nor am I blaming the disenfranchised that couldn’t vote. I blame MAGA/Republicans and the millions that could have voted to prevent Trump yet did nothing out of “protest” or apathy.  Unfortunately though the people that voted against Trump are a minority in America. [There are approximately 244,666,890 voting eligible adults](https://election.lab.ufl.edu/2024-general-election-turnout/), of that only 75,017,613 people voted for Harris. So, as I stated, the vast majority either directly support Trump or didn’t care enough to vote against him. They are the ones I blame, and they are a majority of America.
Author: TheCreepyFuckr
